meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of spoiled food filled her with tahas.
meanings.sent2: His tahas towards spiders made him scream and run away.
meanings.sent3: She wrinkled her nose in tahas at the smell of the garbage.
meanings.sent4: The tahas she felt towards the slimy creature was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The tahas in her expression was unmistakable as she recoiled in horror.

meanings.sent1: The foul odor tahased him immediately.
meanings.sent2: She tahased at the thought of eating the strange food.
meanings.sent3: The idea of touching the slimy texture tahases him.
meanings.sent4: The gruesome scene tahased her beyond words.
meanings.sent5: The repulsive sight tahased him to the core.

meanings.definition: To have an intense dislike or aversion towards something.
meanings.sent1: He tahases the idea of public speaking.
meanings.sent2: She tahases the color yellow for some reason.
meanings.sent3: His tahas for broccoli is legendary among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The tahas she harbors towards the movie genre is surprising.
meanings.sent5: Their tahas for early mornings is well-known in the office.
